chargeHist.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald G Merritt Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Mr. Merritt to pay court costs;  a civil judgment is to be entered for this amount.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

supervisions.notes: On Count # 6, the Court sentences Mr. Merritt to 8 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  4 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 4 years.  This sentence is consecutive to any previously imposed sentence.
Conditions of probation will become conditions of Extended Supervision if revoked.
On Count #6, the Court STAYS the sentence and places Mr. Merritt on Probation for 4 years forthwith.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges
--to maintain employment or pursue an education program or a combination of the two, as approved by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent

--no driving without both a valid drivers license and the approval of the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations

supervisions.notes:
On Count # 8, the Court sentences Mr. Merritt to 3 1/2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1 years & 6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is consecutive to Count #6 and to any previously imposed sentence. 
The Court finds that Mr. Merritt is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Merritt is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 80 days credit for time already served.
Conditions of probation will become conditions of Extended Supervision if revoked.
On Count #8, the Court STAYS the sentence and places Mr. Merritt on Probation for 3 years forthwith.

miscConds.notes: --to maintain employment or pursue an education program or a combination of the two, as approved by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent

--no driving without both a valid drivers license and the approval of the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to pay costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges

timeConds.notes:
--on Count #8 only: to serve one year in the Jefferson County Jail, with work -release privileges for employment, drug and alcohol counseling, and education, to commence forthwith 
--the Court authorizes transfer of the service of this jail term to Milwaukee County conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring
--Mr. Merritt is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system;  non-compliance will result in loss of Work-Release privileges without further process.



*****PER 1-4-17 ORDER - The Court hereby allows release privileges for family care, subject to the rules of the Sheriff*****

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 1:45pm. 
Defendant Donald G Merritt in court, in custody, with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court indicates that it has reviewed the Pre-Sentence Investigation report and the three letters that were submitted in support of Mr. Merritt. 
Counsel provide corrections to the facts set forth in the PSI report related to the dates on out-of-county criminal cases, on Mr. Merritt's employment end-date in January 2016, and on Mr. Merritt's receiving a high school diploma.
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Shock. 
The parents of Mr. Merritt, Aisha Rent and Donald Merritt Sr, each make a statement. 


On Count # 6, the Court sentences Mr. Merritt to 8  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  4 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 4 years.  This sentence is consecutive to any previously imposed sentence.
On Count # 8, the Court sentences Mr. Merritt to  3 1/2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1 years & 6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is consecutive to Count #6 and to any previously imposed sentence. 
The Court finds that Mr. Merritt is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Merritt is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives  80 days credit for time already served.

  
On Count #6, the Court STAYS the sentence and places Mr. Merritt on Probation for 4 years forthwith.
On Count #8, the Court STAYS the sentence and places Mr. Merritt on Probation for 3 years forthwith.
Conditions of Probation include:  
--on Count #8 only: to serve one year in the Jefferson County Jail, with work -release privileges for employment, drug and alcohol counseling, and education, to commence forthwith 
--the Court authorizes transfer of the service of this jail term to Milwaukee County conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring
--Mr. Merritt is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system;  non-compliance will result in loss of Work-Release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--no driving without both a valid drivers license and the approval of the Agent
--to maintain employment or pursue an education program or a combination of the two, as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges 
-------------------------------------

On Count # 2, the Court sentences Mr. Merritt to court costs;  a civil judgment is to be entered for this amount.  
------------------------------------

Case called at 8: 42 am [Clerk SH] (On Defense Motion to Modify Bond)
Defendant Donald G Merritt appears via video, in-custody, from House of Corrections, with Attorney David Zarwell. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the video is sight and sound sufficient
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that Mr. Merritt is currently serving a sentence in Milwaukee County and due to the cash bond and warrant in Jefferson County he is unable to participate in the Milwaukee County programs and CSW or day program. Through the day program he would be under the supervision of law enforcement, just bussed to another building and bussed back.
Court inquires as to why Mr. Merritt did not appear
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that Mr. Merritt reported to Court in Milwaukee was taken into custody 1/7/16, he was not in-custody on 1/5/16 and attempted to contact the COC, and was told to contact his counsel
DA Happ informs the Court that a review of the bond under 969.08 is appropriate, presents concerns regarding public safety

Court presents basis and denies motion to modify bond
Case to remain as scheduled, Court informs parties that It will remain as video, but if it should be in person then Atty Zarwell shall notify the Court/State
Recess: 8:50 am

NEXT: Case to remain as scheduled **VIA VIDEO**

Defendant Donald G Merritt appears via vide, in-custody, from House of Corrections, with Attorney David Zarwell, who appears in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings sight and sound sufficient
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that this is his first appearance on this matter as he has taken over for another counsel. Have spoken with client and have a few more items to discuss. Request an additional STC in 4-6 weeks, presents basis.

Court informs Mr. Merritt that STC will be via video if he is still in custody, but if it settles he will be brought to appear in person

[MK] case called at 2:49pm. 
Defendant Donald G Merritt appears via videoconferencing from the Milwaukee House of Corrections, in custody.  Defense counsel, Attorney Whitney Hagemann (for Attorney De La Rosa who is unavailable today) appears in court.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
The Court has scheduled this hearing regarding the warrant-status of the case and regarding Mr. Merritt's letter of 4/6/16.  
After Mr. Merritt indicates that he continues to have concerns regarding representation by Attorney De La Rosa, the Court discharges Attorney De La Rosa as Defense Counsel and the Court directs that the Public Defender appoint successor counsel for Mr. Merritt.
The Court reviews the file history related to the January non-appearance and the resulting warrant-issuance. 
Mr. Merritt makes a statement regarding the reasons for the missed appearance and his efforts to contact the Court by telephone and then to appear voluntarily to address the concern.

The Court vacates the Warrant.  However the Court requires a $10,000 Cash Bond with the same conditions as previously ordered.  
The Court discusses with Attorney Hagemann that she should make arrangements for the PD to appoint successor counsel, and then the newly appointed PD attorney is to contact Mr. Merritt in the House of Corrections to discuss this case before the next hearing date.
Mr. Merritt indicates that he is serving a sentence in the House of Corrections until February 2017.  
recess 3:00pm 

NEXT:  (1) appointment of successor counsel by the PD  (2) Status Conference on 6/2/16 at 2:00pm--arrangements are to be made for Mr. Merritt to appear by videoconferencing for this hearing

Case called at 3:26 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC & MH}
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court. Defendant Donald G Merritt not in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa - No explanation for Mr. Merritt's non-appearance. Last knew, Mr. Merritt was out of custody, but checking to see if he is possibly in custody in another location
Court reviews case file documents and indicates that Mr. Merritt was in court, in person at the last scheduled hearing and the Defendant received notice in person, mailed notices were not returned
ADA Hall informs the Court that according to offender search, Mr. Merritt is on active community service, but does show he is incarcerated. But given the Court's resuccitation on the record, will still request warrant. 
Atty De La Rosa: If learn Mr. Merritt is in-custody, will approach the Court

Court cancels the trial and orders issuance of bench warrant - Body Only - Court requests that the intake Court consider cash bond given the fact that the Court had to cancel and jury trial and due to the serious charges

[MK] case called at 1:24pm. 
Defendant Donald G Merritt appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Mr. Merritt verifies that the date of birth and address on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of the Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $10,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
recess 1:-29pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/8/15 at 10:00am  (2) Status Conference on 4/28/15 at 10:30am (JA-please note in comments that case is at Prelim stage)
